commitResults.messageTitle: For Level-0: - Changed the Duke.java file to Him.java (will change itf) - Added a Ui class which consists of two methods - Used the Ui class in the Him.java file to greet and farewell users
- Removed Ui.java due to oversight - Reverted to simple print statements and will work on from there
- Removed Ui.java due to oversight - Reverted to simple print statements and will work on from there
- Imported Scanner to retrieve input/output - Allows echoing: For whatever input the program receives, it will regurgitate it. If it's a "bye", the program will exit
commitResults.messageBody:
Mistakes occured:
- The input variable of type String should be nested inside the while loop as to avoid an infinite loop
- Similarly, it was necessary to add a while loop as to make the functionality of the if block work, or else it would also encounter an infinite loop

commitResults.messageTitle: - Added listing functionality to list out added tasks from the "todos" list
commitResults.messageBody:
Mistakes occurred
- Not really a mistake but System.out.printf seems less wordy compared to Systems.out.print(Stringformat...))
- Realized had not removed Ui.java due to some bugs occurred previously

commitResults.messageTitle: - Added Task.java   + Represents tasks   + Has two methods to mark tasks as done or undone   + And a toString method to format output
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added more functionality for the chatbot by allowing it to mark and unmark tasks which are formatted

Mistakes occurred
- Still working on how to better comment
- The previous "todos" accepted a String type, but coming into this variation, the point of marking and unmarking tasks meant initially marking tasks in "todos" from the methods in Task.java was not possible. Changing the type to Task helped fix the bug

commitResults.messageTitle: - Added 3 child classes of Task.java to enhance variety of tasks to todos, deadlines and events
commitResults.messageBody:
Mistakes occurred:
- Lots of repetition with these if-else blocks. Would it be better to use a switch-case instead?

commitResults.messageTitle: - Added testing
commitResults.messageBody:
Mistakes occurred:
- Not being able to run the .bat file. Turns out, we just need a ./runtest.bat
- Changing chatbot name had issues with running the script

commitResults.messageTitle: - Added Exceptions to catch errors for each specific function - A total of 4 errors were handled, including empty descriptions and invalid arguments - Added HimException.java to handle the errors
commitResults.messageBody:
Mistakes occurred:
- Deciding the exceptions seemed to take up some time
- The HimException.java class is never used. I think this is due to the fact that I did not separate the specific errors for it to handle
